p: From Figure 5, it was possible to evaluate monthly variations occurred on SPF. It was observed that January, February and December did not presented statistical difference between the two species, while in the rest of the year, this difference is significant. The best month for M. villosa harvest aiming the highest value of SPF was September (SPF = 13.73). Regarding P. amboinicus, it was observed that April, May, June and July showed the best values of SPF, what may indicate that autumn favors photoprotective activity of this plant, and SPF reaches its maximum of 14.79, other results can also be found in Supplementary Material.
